page.title: 19ELDERLY CARE IN FLEETWOOD
page.content: Worsley House was opened on 7/2/77. Owned by Lancashire County Council Social Service Department.The patients are usually referred to the home by their social worker or doctor.It is a 52 bedroomed home, with all the meals prepared on the premises. On a typical day,the patients get up at about 7.00a.m.,and because the average age of the patients is eighty, most need help in dressing.Breakfast is at 8.30a.m.,after which some are taken to the toilet.With lunch at 12.00p.m. and tea at 4.30p.m.,the patients have time to themselves.Most watch television or sit in one of the sitting rooms. With a staff of thirty-two(most of whom work shifts),Worsley House is quite expensive to maintain,but it is necessary to have this type of establisment to care for old people.
